p: Guayule, Parthenium argentatum A. Gray [ 26], is a semi-arid perennial shrub, native to the Chihuahan desert in Mexico, that reaches a height of 0.3â€“0.9 m in the wild [ 27]. The genus Parthenium, member of the Asteraceae family ( Table 1), encompasses 17 species with gray-green and silvery sheen leaves, but guayule is the only one that produces a significant quantity of natural PI [ 28].
